{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has given birth to a stillborn baby with no visible malformations and an unremarkable placenta. The cause of death is unknown. The most appropriate next step in management would be to perform an autopsy to determine the cause of death. Karyotyping of amniotic fluid (choice A) would not be helpful as the baby has already been born and there are no visible malformations.
